All targets in this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (19). Targets who fail take 2d12+5 physical damage and become Vulnerable until their next roll with Hope. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entry.name: Momentum - Reaction
entry.description: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monster.name: Greater Water Elemental
monster.description: A huge living wave that crashes down upon enemies.
monster.motives: Deluge, disperse, drown

entry.name: Water Jet - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to attack a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d4+7 physical damage and the target's next action has disadvantage. On a failure, the target must mark a Stress.

entry.name: Drowning Embrace - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Elemental succeeds against become Restrained and Vulnerable as they begin drowning. A target can break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Strength or Instinct Roll.

entry.name: High Tide - Reaction
entry.description: When the Elemental makes a successful standard attack, you can mark a Stress to knock the target back to Close range.

monster.name: Huge Green Ooze
monster.description: A translucent green mound of acid taller than most humans.
monster.motives: Camouflage, creep up, envelop, multiply

entry.name: Slow - Passive
entry.description: When you spotlight the Ooze and they don't have a token on their stat block, they can't act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they're preparing to do. When you spotlight the Ooze and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

entry.name: Acidic Form - Passive
entry.description: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can't mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

entry.name: Envelop - Action
entry.description: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the Ooze Envelops them and the target must mark 2 Stress. While Enveloped, the target must mark an additional Stress every time they make an action roll. When the Ooze takes Severe damage, all Enveloped targets are freed and the condition is cleared.

entry.name: Split - Reaction
entry.description: When the Ooze has 4 or more HP marked, you can spend a Fear to split them into two Green Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

monster.name: Hydra
monster.description: A quadrupedal scaled beast with multiple long-necked heads, each filled with menacing fangs.
monster.motives: Devour, regenerate, terrify

entry.name: Many-Headed Menace - Passive
entry.description: The Hydra begins with three heads and can have up to five. When the Hydra takes Major or greater damage, they lose a head.

entry.name: Relentless (X) - Passive
entry.description: The Hydra can be spotlighted X times per GM turn, where X is the Hydra's number of heads. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Regeneration - Action
entry.description: If the Hydra has any marked HP, spend a Fear to clear a HP and grow two heads.

entry.name: Terrifying Chorus - Action
entry.description: All PCs within Far range lose 2 Hope.

entry.name: Magical Weakness - Reaction
entry.description: When the Hydra takes magic damage, they become Dazed until the next roll with Fear. While Dazed, they can't use their Regeneration action but are immune to magic damage.

monster.name: Monarch
monster.description: The sovereign ruler of a nation, unearthed in the privilege of tradition and wielding unmatched power in their domain.
monster.motives: Control vassals, destroy rivals, forge a legacy

entry.name: Execute Them! - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear per PC in the party to have the group condemned for crimes real or imagined. A PC who succeeds on a Presence Roll can demand trial by combat or another special form of trial.

entry.name: Crossguard - Action
entry.description: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon Tier X Minions, who appear at Close range to enforce the Monarch's will.

entry.name: Census Bell - Reaction
entry.description: Long-Term Countdown (8): Spend a Fear to activate after the Monarch's desire for war is first revealed. When it triggers, the Monarch has a reason to rally the nation to war and the support to act on that reason. You gain 1d4 Fear.

monster.name: Stag Knight
monster.description: A knight with huge, majestic antlers wearing armor made of dangerous thorns.
monster.motives: Isolate, maneuver, protect the forest, weed the unwelcome

entry.name: From Above - Passive
entry.description: When the Knight succeeds on a standard attack from above a target, they deal 3d12+3 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

entry.name: Blade of the Forest - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Knight succeeds against take physical damage equal to 3d4 + the target's Major threshold.

entry.name: Thorny Armor - Reaction
entry.description: When the Knight takes damage from an attack within Melee range, you can mark a Stress to deal 1d10+5 physical damage to the attacker.

monster.name: Oak Treant
monster.description: A sturdy animated old-growth tree.
monster.motives: Hide in plain sight, preserve the forest, root down, swing branches

entry.name: Just a Tree - Passive
entry.description: Before they make their first attack in a fight or after they become Hidden, the Treant is indistinguishable from other trees until they next act or a PC succeeds on an Instinct Roll to identify them.

entry.name: Seed Barrage - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress and make an attack against up to three targets within Close range, pummeling them with giant acorns. Targets the Treant succeeds against take 2d10+5 physical damage.

entry.name: Take Root - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to Root the Treant in place. The Treant is Restrained while Rooted, and can end this effect instead of moving while they are spotlighted. While Rooted, the Treant has resistance to physical damage.

monster.name: Treant Sapling
monster.description: A small, sentient tree sapling.
monster.motives: Blend in, preserve the forest, pummel, surround

entry.name: Minion (6) - Passive
entry.description: The Sapling is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Sapling, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

entry.name: Group Attack - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Treant Saplings within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 8 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monster.name: Head Vampire
monster.description: A captivating undead dressed in aristocratic finery.
monster.motives: Create thralls, charm, command, fly, intimidate

entry.name: Terrifying - Passive
entry.description: When the Vampire makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Look Into My Eyes - Passive
entry.description: A creature who moves into Melee range of the Vampire must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, you gain 1d4 Fear.

entry.name: Feed on Followers - Action
entry.description: When the Vampire is within Melee range of an ally, they can cause the ally to mark a HP. The Vampire then clears a HP.

entry.name: The Hunt Is On - Action
entry.description: Spend 2 Fear to summon 1d4 Vampires, who appear at Far range and immediately take the spotlight.

entry.name: Lifesuck - Reaction
entry.description: When the Vampire is spotlighted, roll a d8. On a result of 6 or higher, all targets within Very Close range must mark a HP.

monster.name: Vampire
monster.description: An intelligent undead with blood-stained lips and a predator's smile.
monster.motives: Bite, charm, deceive, feed, intimidate

entry.name: Draining Bite - Action
entry.description: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 4d physical damage. A target who marks HP from this attack loses a Hope and must mark a Stress. The Vampire then clears a HP.

entry.name: Mistform - Reaction
entry.description: When the Vampire takes physical damage, you can spend a Fear to take half damage.

monster.name: Vault Guardian Sentinel
monster.description: A dust-covered golden construct with boxy limbs and a huge mace for a hand.
monster.motives: Destroy at any cost, expunge, protect

entry.name: Kinetic Slam - Passive
entry.description: Targets who take damage from the Sentinel's standard attack are knocked back to Very Close range.

entry.name: Box In - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to choose a target within Very Close range to focus on. That target has disadvantage on attack rolls when they're within Very Close range of the Sentinel. The Sentinel can only focus on one target at a time.

entry.name: Mana Bolt - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to lob explosive magic at a point within Far range. All targets within Very Close range of that point must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 8d20 magic damage and are knocked back to Close range. Targets who succeed take half damage and aren't knocked back.

entry.name: Momentum - Reaction
entry.description: When the Sentinel makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monster.name: Vault Guardian Turret
monster.description: A massive hulking turret with reinforced armor and twelve piston-driven mechanical legs.
monster.motives: Concentrate fire, lock down, mark, protect

entry.name: Slow Firing - Passive
entry.description: When you spotlight the Turret and they don't have a token on their stat block, they can't make a standard attack. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they're preparing to do. When you spotlight the Turret and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can attack.

entry.name: Mark Target - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to Mark a target within Far range until the Turret is destroyed or the Marked target becomes Hidden. While the target is Marked, their Evasion is halved.

entry.name: Concentrate Fire - Reaction
entry.description: When another adversary deals damage to a target within Far range of the Turret, you can mark a Stress to add the Turret's standard attack damage to the damage roll.

entry.name: Detonation - Reaction
entry.description: When the Turret is destroyed, they explode. All targets within Close range must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 3d20 physical damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

monster.name: Vault Guardian Gaoler
monster.description: A boxy, dust-covered construct with thick metallic swinging doors on their torso.
monster.motives: Carry away, entrap, protect, pummel

entry.name: Blocking Shield - Passive
entry.description: Creatures within Melee range of the Gaoler have disadvantage on attack rolls against them. Creatures trapped inside the Gaoler are immune to this feature.

entry.name: Lock Up - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, the target is Restrained within the Gaoler until freed with a successful Strength Roll (18). While Restrained, the target can only attack the Gaoler.

monster.name: Young Ice Dragon
monster.description: A glacier-blue dragon with four powerful limbs and frost-tinged wings.
monster.motives: Avalanche, defend lair, fly, freeze, defend what is mine, maul

entry.name: Relentless (3) - Passive
entry.description: The Dragon can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Rend and Crush - Passive
entry.description: If a target damaged by the Dragon doesn't mark an Armor Slot to reduce the damage, they must mark a Stress.

entry.name: No Hope - Passive
entry.description: When a PC rolls with Fear while within Far range of the Dragon, they lose a Hope.

entry.name: Blizzard Breath - Action
entry.description: Spend 2 Fear to release an icy whirlwind in an area within Close range. All targets in this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 4d6+5 magic damage and are Restrained by ice until they break free with a successful Strength Roll. Targets who succeed must mark 2 Stress or take half damage.

entry.name: Avalanche - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to have the Dragon unleash a huge downfall of snow and ice, covering all other creatures within Far range. All targets within this area must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or be buried in snow and rocks, becoming Vulnerable until they dig themselves out from the debris. For each PC that fails the reaction roll, you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Frozen Scales - Reaction
entry.description: When a creature makes a successful attack against the Dragon from within Very Close range, they must mark a Stress and become Chilled until their next rest or they clear a Stress. While they are Chilled, they have disadvantage on attack rolls.

entry.name: Momentum - Reaction
entry.description: When the Dragon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monster.name: Arch-Necromancer
monster.description: A decaying mage adorned in dark, tattered robes.
monster.motives: Corrupt, decay, flee to fight another day, resurrect

entry.name: Dance of Death - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to spotlight 1d4 allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage, or full damage if you spend a Fear.

entry.name: Beam of Decay - Action
entry.description: Mark 2 Stress to cause all targets within Far range to make a Strength Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d20+12 magic damage and you gain a Fear. Targets who succeed take half damage. A target who marks 2 or more HP must also mark 2 Stress and becomes Vulnerable until they roll with Hope.

entry.name: Open the Gates of Death - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to summon a Zombie Legion, which appears at Close range and immediately takes the spotlight.

entry.name: Not Today, My Dears - Reaction
entry.description: When the Necromancer has marked 7 or more of their HP, you can spend a Fear to have them teleport away to a safe location to recover. A PC who succeeds on an Instinct Roll can trace the teleportation magic to their destination.

entry.name: Your Demise is Near - Reaction
entry.description: Countdown (2d6). When the Necromancer has marked 6 or more of their HP, activate the countdown. When it triggers, deal 2d10+6 direct magic damage to a target within Close range. The Necromancer then clears a number of Stress or HP equal to the number of HP marked by the target from this attack.

monster.name: Fallen Shock Troop
monster.description: A cursed soul bound to the Fallen's will.
monster.motives: Crush, dominate, earn relief, punish

entry.name: Minion (12) - Passive
entry.description: The Shock Troop is defeated when they take any damage. For every 12 damage a PC deals to the Shock Troop, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

entry.name: Aura of Doom - Passive
entry.description: When a PC marks HP from an attack by the Shock Troop, they lose a Hope.

entry.name: Group Attack - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Fallen Shock Troops within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 12 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monster.name: Fallen Sorcerer
monster.description: Warped mage bound by the bargains they made in life.
monster.motives: Acquire, dishearten, dominate, torment

entry.name: Conflagration - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to unleash an all-consuming firestorm and make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Sorcerer succeeds against take 2d10+6 direct magic damage.

entry.name: Nightmare Tableau - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to trap a target within Far range in a powerful illusion of their worst fears. While trapped, the target is Restrained and Vulnerable until they break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Instinct Roll.

entry.name: Slippery - Reaction
entry.description: When the Sorcerer takes damage from an attack, they can teleport up to Far range.

entry.name: Shackles of Guilt - Reaction
entry.description: Countdown (Loop 2d6). When the Sorcerer is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, all targets within Far range become Vulnerable and must mark a Stress as they relive their greatest regrets. A target can break free from their regret with a successful Presence or Strength Roll. When a PC fails to break free, they lose a Hope.

monster.name: Fallen Warlord: Realm-Breaker
monster.description: A fallen God, wreathed in rage and resentment, bearing millennia of experience in breaking heroes' spirits.
monster.motives: Corrupt, dominate, punish, break the weak

entry.name: Relentless (2) - Passive
entry.description: The Realm-Breaker can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Firespite Plate Armor - Passive
entry.description: When the Realm-Breaker takes damage, reduce it by 2d10.

entry.name: Tormenting Lash - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. When a target uses armor to reduce damage from this attack, they must mark 2 Armor Slots.

entry.name: All-Consuming Rage - Reaction
entry.description: Countdown (Decreasing 8). When the Realm-Breaker is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, create a torrent of incarnate rage that rends flesh from bone. All targets within Far range must make a Presence Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d6+10 direct magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage. For each HP marked from this damage, summon a Fallen Shock Troop within Very Close range of the target who marked that HP. If the countdown ever decreases its maximum value to 0, the Realm-Breaker marks their remaining HP and all targets within Far range must mark all remaining HP and make a death move.

entry.name: Doombringer - Reaction
entry.description: When a target marks HP from an attack by the Realm-Breaker, all PCs within Far range of the target must lose a Hope.

entry.name: I Have Never Known Defeat (Phase Change) - Reaction
entry.description: When the Realm-Breaker marks their last HP, replace them with the Undefeated Champion and immediately spotlight them.

monster.name: Fallen Warlord: Undefeated Champion
monster.description: That which only the most feared have a chance to fear.
monster.motives: Dispatch merciless death, punish the defiant, secure victory at any cost

entry.name: Relentless (3) - Passive
entry.description: The Undefeated Champion can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Faltering Armor - Passive
entry.description: When the Undefeated Champion takes damage, reduce it by 1d10.

entry.name: Shattering Strike - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. PCs the Champion succeeds against lose a number of Hope equal to the HP they marked from this attack.

entry.name: Endless Legions - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to summon a number of Fallen Shock Troops equal to twice the number of PCs. The Shock Troops appear at Far range.

entry.name: Circle of Defilement - Reaction
entry.description: Countdown (1d8). When the Undefeated Champion is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, activate a magical circle covering an area within Far range of the Champion. A target within that area is Vulnerable until they leave the circle. The circle can be removed by dealing Severe damage to the Undefeated Champion.

entry.name: Doombringer - Reaction
entry.description: When the Undefeated Champion makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Doombringer - Reaction
entry.description: When a target marks HP from an attack by the Undefeated Champion, all PCs within Far range of the target lose a Hope.

monster.name: Hallowed Archer
monster.description: Spirit soldiers with sanctified bows.
monster.motives: Focus fire, obey, retribution, volley

entry.name: Punish the Guilty - Passive
entry.description: The Archer deals double damage to targets marked Guilty by a High Seraph.

entry.name: Divine Volley - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against up to three targets.

monster.name: Hallowed Soldier
monster.description: Souls of the faithful, lifted up with divine weaponry.
monster.motives: Obey, outmaneuver, punish, swarm

entry.name: Minion (13) - Passive
entry.description: The Soldier is defeated when they take any damage. For every 13 damage a PC deals to the Soldier, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

entry.name: Divine Flight - Passive
entry.description: While the Soldier is flying, spend a Fear to move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.

entry.name: Group Attack - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Hallowed Soldiers within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 10 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monster.name: High Seraph
monster.description: A divine champion, head of a hallowed host of warriors who enforce their god's will.
monster.motives: Enforce dogma, fly, pronounce judgment, smite

entry.name: Relentless (2) - Passive
entry.description: The Seraph can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Divine Flight - Passive
entry.description: While the Seraph is flying, spend a Fear to move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.

entry.name: Judgment - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to make a target Guilty in the eyes of the Seraph's god until the Seraph is defeated. While Guilty, the target doesn't gain Hope on a result with Hope. When the Seraph succeeds on a standard attack against a Guilty target, they deal Severe damage instead of their standard damage. The Seraph can only mark one target at a time.

entry.name: God Rays - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to reflect a sliver of divinity as a searing beam of light that hits up to twenty targets within Very Far range. Targets must make a Presence Reaction Roll, with disadvantage if they are marked Guilty. Targets who fail take 4d6+12 magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

entry.name: We Are One - Action
entry.description: Once per scene, spend a Fear to spotlight all other adversaries within Far range. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

monster.name: Kraken
monster.description: A legendary beast of the sea, bigger than the largest galleon, with sucker-laden tentacles and a terrifying maw.
monster.motives: Consume, crush, drown, grapple

entry.name: Relentless (3) - Passive
entry.description: The Kraken can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Many Tentacles - Passive
entry.description: While the Kraken has 7 or fewer marked HP, they can make their standard attack against two targets within range.

entry.name: Grapple and Drown - Action
entry.description: Make an attack roll against a target within Close range. On a success, mark a Stress to grab them with a tentacle and drag them beneath the water. The target is Restrained and Vulnerable until they break free with a successful Strength Roll or the Kraken takes Major or greater damage. While Restrained and Vulnerable in this way, a target must mark a Stress when they make an action roll.

entry.name: Boiling Blast - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to spew a line of boiling water at any number of targets in a line up to Far range. All targets must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 4d6+9 physical damage. If a target marks an Armor Slot to reduce the damage, they must also mark a Stress.

entry.name: Momentum - Reaction
entry.description: When the Kraken makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monster.name: Oracle Of Doom
monster.description: A towering immortal and incarnation of fate, cursed to only see bad outcomes.
monster.motives: Change environment, condemn, dishearten, toss aside

entry.name: Terrifying - Passive
entry.description: When the Oracle makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Walls Closing In - Passive
entry.description: When a creature rolls a failure while within Very Far range of the Oracle, they must mark a Stress.

entry.name: Pronounce Fate - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to present a target within Far range with a vision of their personal nightmare. The target must make a Knowledge Reaction Roll. On a failure, they lose all Hope and take 2d10+4 direct magic damage. On a success, they take half damage and lose a Hope.

entry.name: Summon Tormentors - Action
entry.description: Once per day, spend 2 Fear to summon 2d4 Tier 2 or below Minions relevant to one of the PC's personal nightmares. They appear at Close range relative to that PC.

entry.name: Ominous Knowledge - Reaction
entry.description: When the Oracle sees a mortal creature, they instantly know one of their personal nightmares.

entry.name: Vengeful Fate - Reaction
entry.description: When the Oracle marks HP from an attack within Very Close range, you can mark a Stress to knock the attacker back to Far range and deal 2d10+4 physical damage.

monster.name: Outer Realms Abomination
monster.description: A chaotic mockery of life, constantly in flux.
monster.motives: Confuse, demolish, devour, undermine

entry.name: Chaotic Form - Passive
entry.description: When the Abomination attacks, roll 2d4 and use the result as their attack modifier.

entry.name: Disorienting Presence - Passive
entry.description: When a target takes damage from the Abomination, they must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, they gain disadvantage on their next action roll and you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Reality Quake - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to rattle the edges of reality within Far range of the Abomination. All targets within that area must succeed on a Knowledge Reaction Roll or become Unstuck from reality until the end of the scene. When an Unstuck target spends Hope or marks Armor Slots, HP, or Stress, they must double the amount spent or marked.

entry.name: Fungal Form - Reaction
entry.description: When the Abomination takes damage, reduce it by 1d20. If the Abomination marks 1 or fewer Hit Points from a successful attack against them, you gain a Fear.

monster.name: Outer Realms Corrupter
monster.description: A shifting, formless mass seemingly made of chromatic light.
monster.motives: Confuse, distract, overwhelm

entry.name: Will-Shattering Touch - Passive
entry.description: When a PC takes damage from the Corrupter, they lose a Hope.

entry.name: Disgorge Reality Flotsam - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to spew partially digested portions of consumed realities at all targets within Close range. Targets must succeed on a Knowledge Reaction Roll or mark 2 Stress.

monster.name: Outer Realms Thrall
monster.description: A vaguely humanoid form stripped of memory and identity.
monster.motives: Destroy, disgust, disorient, intimidate
monster.standard_attack: Claws and Teeth: Very Close - 11 phy

entry.name: Minion (13) - Passive
entry.description: The Thrall is defeated when they take any damage. For every 13 damage a PC deals to the Thrall, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

entry.name: Group Attack - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Outer Realm Thralls within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 11 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monster.name: Volcanic Dragon: Ashen Tyrant
monster.description: A legendary, lava-hardened dragon. No enemy has ever had the insolence to wound the dragon so.
monster.motives: Choke, fly, intimidate, kill or be killed

entry.name: Relentless (4) - Passive
entry.description: The Ashen Tyrant can be spotlighted up to four times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Cornered - Passive
entry.description: Mark a Stress instead of spending a Fear to spotlight the Ashen Tyrant.

entry.name: Ashes to Ashes - Passive
entry.description: When a PC rolls a failure while within Close range of the Ashen Tyrant, they lose a Hope and you gain a Fear. If the PC can't lose a Hope, they must mark a HP.

entry.name: Desperate Rampage - Action
entry.description: Mark 3 Stress to make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Ashen Tyrant succeeds against take 2d20+2 physical damage, are knocked back to Close range of where they were, and must mark a Stress.

entry.name: Ashen Cloud - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to smash the ground beneath an adversary within Far range. While within the ash cloud, a target has disadvantage on action rolls. The ash cloud clears the next time an adversary is spotlighted.

entry.name: Apocalyptic Thrashing - Action
entry.description: Countdown (1d12). Spend a Fear to activate it. It ticks down when a PC rolls with Fear. When it reaches 0, the Ashen Tyrant thrashes about, causing environmental damage (such as an earthquake, avalanche, or collapsing walls). All targets within Far range must make a Strength Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d10+10 physical damage and are Restrained by the rubble until they break free with a successful Strength Roll. Targets who succeed take half damage. If the Ashen Tyrant is defeated while this countdown is active, trigger the countdown immediately as the destruction caused by their death throes.

monster.name: Volcanic Dragon: Molten Scourge
monster.description: Engaged by their wounds, the dragon bursts into molten lava.
monster.motives: Douse with lava, incinerate, repel invaders, respawn

entry.name: Relentless (3) - Passive
entry.description: Can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

entry.name: Cracked Scales - Passive
entry.description: When the Molten Scourge takes damage, roll a number of d6s equal to HP marked. For each result of 4 or higher, you gain a Fear.

entry.name: Shattering Might - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, target takes 4d8+14 physical damage, loses a Hope, and is knocked back to Close range. The Scourge clears a Stress.

entry.name: Eruption - Action
entry.description: Spend a Fear to erupt lava from beneath the Scourge's scales, filling area within Very Close range with lava. All targets must make Agility Reaction Roll or take 4d6+6 physical damage and be knocked back to Close range. The area remains lava (6 HP damage on entry or action).

entry.name: Volcanic Breath - Reaction
entry.description: When the Scourge takes Major damage, roll d10. On 8+, erupt lava in Very Close range: Agility Reaction Roll or take 2d10+4 physical damage, mark 1d4 Stress, and are Vulnerable until clearing a Stress; success = half damage + mark a Stress.;Lava Splash - Reaction;When the Scourge takes Severe damage from attack within Very Close, molten blood deals 2d10+4 direct physical damage to attacker.;Ashen Vengeance (Phase Change) - Reaction;When the Scourge marks last HP, replace with Ashen Tyrant and immediately spotlight.

monster.name: Volcanic Dragon: Obsidian Predator
monster.description: A massive winged creature with obsidian scales and impossibly sharp claws.
monster.motives: Defend lair, dive-bomb, fly, hunt, intimidate

entry.name: Relentless (2) - Passive
entry.description: Can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight.

entry.name: Flying - Passive
entry.description: While flying, gains +3 Difficulty.

entry.name: Obsidian Scales - Passive
entry.description: Resistant to physical damage.

entry.name: Obsidian Tail - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to make attack against all targets within Close range. Success: 4d6+4 physical damage, knocked to Far range and Vulnerable until next roll with Hope.

entry.name: Dive-Bomb - Action
entry.description: If flying, mark a Stress to choose point within Far range, move there, attack all targets within Very Close range; on success, 2d10+6 physical, mark a Stress, lose a Hope.

entry.name: Erupting Rage (Phase Change) - Reaction
entry.description: When marks last HP, replace with Molten Scourge and immediately spotlight.

monster.name: Perfected Zombie
monster.description: A towering, muscular zombie with magically infused strength and skill.
monster.motives: Consume, hound, maim, terrify

entry.name: Terrifying - Passive
entry.description: On successful attack, all PCs in Far range lose Hope and you gain Fear.

entry.name: Fearsome Presence - Passive
entry.description: PCs can't spend Hope to use features against the Zombie.

entry.name: Perfect Strike - Action
entry.description: Mark a Stress to attack all targets within Very Close range; on success, targets are Vulnerable until next rest.

entry.name: Skilled Opportunist - Reaction
entry.description: When another adversary deals damage to target within Very Close range of Zombie, spend a Fear to add Zombie's standard attack damage to the damage roll.

monster.name: Zombie Legion
monster.description: A large pack of undead, still powerful despite their rotting flesh.
monster.motives: Consume brain, shred flesh, surround

entry.name: Horde (2d6+5) - Passive
entry.description: When Legion has half or more HP marked, standard attack deals 2d6+5 physical damage instead.

entry.name: Unyielding - Passive
entry.description: Legion has resistance to physical damage.

entry.name: Relentless (2) - Passive
entry.description: Legion can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight.

entry.name: Overwhelm - Reaction
entry.description: When Legion takes Minor damage from attack within Melee, mark a Stress to make standard attack with advantage against the attacker.
